Theme System / Customization

Custom Themes

Create your own custom theme by defining colors, typography, spacing, and effects to match your brand identity.

Creating a Custom Theme

Create a new theme from scratch with full control over all design tokens:

Swift 
import LuxeUI

let myBrandTheme = Theme(
    // Primary colors
    primaryColor: Color(hex: "#FF6B35"),
    secondaryColor: Color(hex: "#004E89"),
    accentColor: .cyan,
    
    // Background colors
    backgroundColor: Color(red: 0.05, green: 0.05, blue: 0.08),
    surfaceColor: Color(red: 0.1, green: 0.1, blue: 0.12),
    
    // Text colors
    textColor: .white,
    textSecondaryColor: .white.opacity(0.7),
    
    // Layout settings
    cornerRadius: 20,
    spacingM: 16,
    shadowRadius: 12,
    
    // Behavior
    animationDuration: 0.3,
    enableHaptics: true
)

// Apply to your app
ContentView()
    .luxeTheme(myBrandTheme)

Modifying Preset Themes

Start from a preset and modify specific properties using the builder pattern:

Swift 
let customizedMidnight = Theme.midnight
    .withPrimaryColor(.orange)
    .withSecondaryColor(.pink)
    .withCornerRadius(24)
    .withHaptics(false)

ContentView()
    .luxeTheme(customizedMidnight)

Custom Color Scheme

For complete color control, create a custom LuxeColorScheme:

Swift 
let brandColors = LuxeColorScheme(
    primary: Color(hex: "#6366F1"),      // Indigo
    secondary: Color(hex: "#EC4899"),    // Pink
    accent: Color(hex: "#14B8A6"),       // Teal
    background: Color(hex: "#0F0F23"),   // Dark navy
    surface: Color(hex: "#1A1A3E"),      // Slightly lighter
    text: .white,
    textSecondary: .white.opacity(0.7),
    success: Color(hex: "#10B981"),      // Emerald
    warning: Color(hex: "#F59E0B"),      // Amber
    error: Color(hex: "#EF4444"),        // Red
    info: Color(hex: "#3B82F6")          // Blue
)

let brandTheme = Theme(colors: brandColors)

Custom Typography

Define your typography scale:

Swift 
let customTypography = LuxeTypography(
    fontSizeXS: 10,
    fontSizeS: 12,
    fontSizeM: 14,
    fontSizeL: 16,
    fontSizeXL: 20,
    fontSizeXXL: 28,
    fontSizeDisplay: 40,
    fontWeightRegular: .regular,
    fontWeightMedium: .medium,
    fontWeightBold: .bold,
    lineHeightNormal: 1.5
)

let theme = Theme(typography: customTypography)

Custom Spacing Scale

Define consistent spacing values:

Swift 
let customSpacing = LuxeSpacing(
    xxxs: 2,    // Hairline
    xxs: 4,     // Tight
    xs: 8,      // Compact
    s: 12,      // Small
    m: 16,      // Medium (common default)
    l: 24,      // Large
    xl: 32,     // Extra large
    xxl: 48,    // Section spacing
    xxxl: 64    // Major section spacing
)

Complete Custom Theme

Here's a full example bringing everything together:

Swift 
import LuxeUI

struct BrandTheme {
    static let main = Theme(
        primaryColor: Color(hex: "#FF6B35"),
        secondaryColor: Color(hex: "#004E89"),
        accentColor: Color(hex: "#1BE7FF"),
        backgroundColor: Color(hex: "#0A0A0F"),
        surfaceColor: Color(hex: "#141420"),
        textColor: .white,
        textSecondaryColor: .white.opacity(0.7),
        typography: LuxeTypography(),
        spacing: LuxeSpacing(),
        borderRadius: LuxeBorderRadius(m: 16, l: 20, xl: 28),
        effects: LuxeEffects(shadowMedium: 12, animationNormal: 0.25),
        cornerRadius: 20,
        enableHaptics: true
    )
}

// Usage
@main
struct MyApp: App {
    var body: some Scene {
        WindowGroup {
            ContentView()
                .luxeTheme(BrandTheme.main)
        }
    }
}
